alert.note: Alert for Gordon; Murray; Whitfield (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 05 at 2:15AM EST until February 06 at 2:12AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Conasauga River near Tilton affecting Whitfield, Gordon and Murray Counties. For the Conasauga River Basin...including Tilton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Conasauga River near Tilton. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 18 feet, Flood stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands...fields and pastures along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on the Brackett Ridge Road bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM EST Saturday the stage was 17.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 18.3 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 18 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.3 feet on 02/28/1992. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
